result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward S. Burke III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. May Not have contact with Ashley L M other than through 3rd party contact -  RE:  Child or family of the victim.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Cash bond refunded per court;  gb/mg  ck#16CH077324
Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  16CF852 dismissed & read-in.  State withdraws motion to forfeit bond.  Bond to be returned to poster.  Defendant is sentenced to 9 years in the WSP; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 180 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

******BOND HAS BEEN REVOKED - DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN CUSTODY UNTIL FINAL DISPOISITION OF CASE***********

940.06(1) - 2nd  degree reckless  homicide PTAC

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody re 16-CF-852)) with Atty Terry W. Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to suppress is withdrawn.  State's motion to forfeit bond is withdrawn.  Amended Information filed charging 2nd degree reckless homicide/deliver drugs, PTAC.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 10/11/16 at 4:30.  $5,000.00 cash bond that is posted is revoked; no bond allowed.  Cash to be held pending sentencing hearing on 10/11/16.
to forfeit bond; filed by ADA C McNeill.

Atty Rose's suppresion motion; states he is not going to proceed w/suppression as to the search of the cell phone.  Witnesses are sequestered.  Testimony taken from:  KPD Detective Peter Falk, KPD Officer B. McDonough.  Court to review video of interview of defendant outside of court.  Case remains set for trial, co-deft trial will proceed first on 8/29/16 if no other case proceeds first on that date; MH continued to 8/22/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose's motion to sever.  ADA McNeill states no objection to motion.  Court grants motion to sever case from 15CF852.  ADA McNeill requests to adjourn trial as the ME is unavailable the week of 2/22/16.  Atty Rose states he is prepared to proceed on 2/22; requests to modify bond.  Statement from Jamie M.  Court grants adjournment of trial from 2/22/16 at 8:30am to 6/6/16 at 8:30am.  Court amends bond to $5,000 cash bond w/conditions *No contact w/Ashley M. *No discussion of case with anyone other than counsel. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Ashley M, Tiffany B, Christina G, RIchard B S, Thomas K.  *On house arrest other than for treatment, meetings with attorney or court hearings.  *No contact w/DiBiase family.

Defendant Edward S. Burke appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. Parties waive DA PTC  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:45 am.
